column4: When kubuntu is installed for the first time, an xorg.conf file is automatically generated. How can I regenerate this after the install? (I want to completely display reset all changes I have made)

this asks me a whole bunch of questions. The installer could deduce all of it automatically. I don't want to make any wrong configurations so can I somehow make it re-generate the xorg.conf file automatically?
It outputs something. Not sure what to do
you should paste what it outputs
It outputs "Reinstallation of kde-guidance is not possible, it cannot be downloaded."
that is not wzhat it outputs. read my question again and this time do what I asked you

You asked me about apt-cache policy kde-guidance if I remember correctly but you never answered when I asked about how to interpret the output. The output lists the local .deb-file as first priority and the repository as second.
21:28 < wols_> xst: you should paste what it outputs
download it from packages.ubuntu.com, install it via dpkg -i
